commit_message:
Image and flavor defined ephemeral storage encryption

This spec introduces the API, compute and high level virt layer changes
required by a new image and flavor defined approach to ephemeral storage
encryption.

Future specs will detail the required changes by individual virt drivers
to introduce support for specific encryption formats and options.

Part of blueprint ephemeral-storage-encryption

Change-Id: I23379c73be6f7215b5cb31b523ff5371ee17c038
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/84/752284/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================================== Flavor and image defined ephemeral storage encryption ====================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/eph-storage-encryption This spec aims to outline a new approach to ephemeral storage encryption using flavor extra specs and image properties to bring it in line with the current block storage encryption implementation provided by Cinder. The spec covers the changes to the API and compute layers only, implementation within specific virt drivers is left for future specs. Problem description =================== At present the only in-tree ephemeral storage encryption support is provided by the libvirt virt driver. This current implementation provides basic operator controlled and configured host specific support for ephemeral disk encryption where all instances on a given compute either use ephemeral encryption or not. This is not ideal and makes ephemeral storage encryption completely opaque to the end user as opposed to the block storage encryption support provided by Cinder where users are able to opt-in to using admin defined encrypted volume types to ensure their storage is encrypted as rest. Finally and somewhat unrelated to this spec the current implementation is also further limited to the lvm imagebackend within the libvirt virt driver and only supports the dm-crypt ``PLAIN`` encryption format. Use Cases --------- * As a user I want to request that all of my ephemeral storage is encrypted through the selection of a specific instance flavor or image. * As an admin/operator I want to provide multiple choices to my end users regarding how their ephemeral storage is encrypted using instance flavors and images. * As an admin/operator I want to avoid any host configurables that globally enable or disable ephemeral storage encryption per compute host. * As a virt driver maintainer/developer I want to indicate that my driver supports ephemeral storage encryption for users during instance scheduling. Proposed change =============== Given the aims of this spec the initial step will be the deprecation of the original ephemeral storage encryption implementation within the libvirt virt driver. A migration path from this implementation will be documented in a separate spec and that will need to be implemented before its eventual removal in a future cycle. New instance flavor extra specs and image properties will be introduced, these will control both when and how ephemeral storage encryption is used. * ``hw_eph_encryption`` * ``hw_eph_encryption_format`` * ``hw_eph_encryption_options`` * ``hw:eph_encryption`` * ``hw:eph_encryption_format`` * ``hw:eph_encryption_options`` New configurables will be introduced to provide operator controlled default format and options. * ``[ephemeral_encryption]/default_format`` * ``[ephemeral_encryption]/default_options`` New ``COMPUTE_EPH_ENCRYPTION_$FORMAT`` compute compatibility traits will be added to os-traits and used by virt drivers to indicate support for specific ephemeral storage encryption formats. When either ``hw_eph_encryption`` or ``hw:eph_encryption`` are present the ``COMPUTE_EPH_ENCRYPTION_$FORMAT`` trait will be used as a required trait when querying Placement for available hosts. The ``BlockDeviceMapping`` object will be extended to include ``encrypted``, ``encryption_format`` and ``encryption_options`` attributes to be used by the encrypted ephemeral devices. This will then allow virt drivers to lookup and use the associated options when using the devices. TODO - How will this work with images already encrypted in Glance? Alternatives ------------ As always we could no nothing and continue with the current implementation. Data model impact ----------------- New flavor extra specs and image properties as listed above. REST API impact --------------- N/A Security impact --------------- N/A Notifications impact -------------------- N/A Other end user impact --------------------- Admins will now need to define additional flavors and/or images enabling ephemeral storage encryption. Performance Impact ------------------ N/A Other deployer impact --------------------- Operators can optionally change the default ephemeral encryption format and options via host configurables. Developer impact ---------------- Virt driver developers will be able to indicate support for specific ephemeral storage encryption formats using the newly introduced compute compatibility traits. Upgrade impact -------------- A migration path between the existing libvirt virt driver ephemeral storage encryption implementation will be provided in a separate spec well in advance of its removal. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: lyarwood Other contributors: Feature Liaison --------------- Feature liaison: N/A Work Items ---------- * Deprecate the existing libvirt ephemeral storage encryption implementation * Introduce a ``hw_eph_encryption*`` image properties * Introduce a ``hw:eph_encryption*`` flavor extra specs * Introduce a ``COMPUTE_EPH_ENCRYPTION_$FORMAT`` compute compatibility traits * Introduce a new ``encrypted``, ``encryption_format`` and ``encryption_options`` attributes to the BlockDeviceMapping Object Dependencies ============ N/A Testing ======= Without a virt driver implementation this will be tested entirely without our unit and functional test suites. Documentation Impact ==================== * New host configurables * New flavor extra specs and image properties References ========== History ======= Optional section intended to be used each time the spec is updated to describe new design, API or any database schema updated. Useful to let reader understand what's happened along the time. .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Wallaby - Introduced

commit_message:
Remove race due to 1907084

The test_attach_scsi_disk_with_config_drive test cases is racy at volume
detach. Nova first detach the volume in cinder then later deletes the
BlockDeviceMapping from the nova DB. Test waits for the volume to become
available and then checks the list of volume attachments in the nova API
then it can see that the attachment is still there.

Closes-Bug: #1907084
Change-Id: I814ae3215f39d1e8407c4ca1c7117a314941c80b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/14/765814/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def wait_for_volume_attachment_remove_from_compute( client, server_id, volume_id): """Waits for a volume to be removed from a given server. This waiter checks the compute API if the volume attachment is removed. """ start = int(time.time()) volumes = client.list_volume_attachments(server_id)['volumeAttachments'] while any(volume for volume in volumes if volume['volumeId'] == volume_id): time.sleep(client.build_interval) timed_out = int(time.time()) - start >= client.build_timeout if timed_out: message = ('Volume %s failed to detach from server %s within ' 'the required time (%s s) from the compute API ' 'perspective' % (volume_id, server_id, client.build_timeout)) raise lib_exc.TimeoutException(message) volumes = client.list_volume_attachments(server_id)[ 'volumeAttachments'] return volumes

commit_message:
Add config-download-dir flag to cell export command

`overcloud cell export` command does not have option
to provide from where to copy export data if config-download
data is exported to custom directory.

This change add the option for `overcloud cell export` command
to provide custom directory.

Change-Id: I8e2a0922662c0a4d913469fcf2b3180d31512b0f

commit_message:
Remove use of custom network setup

Tempest will create a tenant network for us and manage it
all so no need to do this within this plugin.

Change-Id: Ie87bf09eb96ebc05f874df9cdf5c87e3f0c79f78

In dev node, Trove instance needs to connect with control host router_params = { 'name': cls.get_resource_name("router"), 'external_gateway_info': { "network_id": CONF.network.public_network_id } } result = routers_client.create_router(**router_params) router_id = result['router']['id'] LOG.info('Private router created: %s', result['router']) cls.addClassResourceCleanup( utils.wait_for_removal, routers_client.delete_router, routers_client.show_router, router_id ) routers_client.add_router_interface(router_id, subnet_id=subnet_id) LOG.info('Subnet %s added to the router %s', subnet_id, router_id) cls.addClassResourceCleanup( routers_client.remove_router_interface, router_id, subnet_id=subnet_id ) @classmethod # Create network for database instance, use cls.private_network as the # network ID. cls._create_network() "nics": [{"net-id": cls.private_network}], "nics": [{"net-id": cls.private_network}],

commit_message:
Test attach scsi disk with config drive enabled

There were recently issues discovered in nova as it
used to consider only an instance's existing volumes
when finding the next available SCSI address when
attaching the volume, so for example if the instance
has config drive in the shape of a SCSI CDROM, it's
SCSI address gets ignored in the new address calculation
and thus there will be address collision in the xml and
libvirt will complain and hence the attachment to volume
failed with the error that the doamin already contains
the disk with that address.

This test will actually covers the same scenario by
enabling the config drive and attach/detach the volume
to the instance that is boot up using the custom image
meta property hw_cdrom_bus and hw_disk_bus as scsi
with virtio-scsi mode.

There is an additional create_image_with custom prop.
method created that will copy the default image used
in the conf. and then updating it with the custom
property mentioned in the attach scsi volume test.

Also to create an image with the custom property needs
admin priviliges for image_client so hence adding the
test here in admin tests with updating the image_client
with admin privilege in compute admin test class.

Related-Bug: #1867075

Change-Id: I9c7be55aaa363860a78d2efe2a4685433777625b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/48/758848/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('1babdb7e-bf6c-4268-acaf-ee18edd9d3db') def test_attach_scsi_disk_with_config_drive(self): """Test the attach/detach volume with config drive/scsi disk Enable the config drive, followed by booting an instance from an image with virtio-scsi and hw_cdrom: scsi property and validate the attach/detach of the volume """ custom_img = self.create_image_with_custom_property( hw_scsi_model='virtio-scsi', hw_disk_bus='scsi', hw_cdrom_bus='scsi') server = self.create_test_server(custom_img, config_drive=True) volume = self.create_volume() attachment = self.attach_volume(server, volume) waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status( self.volumes_client, attachment['volumeId'], 'in-use') volume_after_attach = self.servers_client.list_volume_attachments( server['id'])['volumeAttachments'] self.assertEqual(1, len(volume_after_attach), "Failed to attach volume") self.servers_client.detach_volume( server['id'], attachment['volumeId']) waiters.wait_for_volume_resource_status( self.volumes_client, attachment['volumeId'], 'available') volume_after_detach = self.servers_client.list_volume_attachments( server['id'])['volumeAttachments'] self.assertEqual(0, len(volume_after_detach), "Failed to detach volume")

commit_message:
Disable caching done by ganesha

Disable caching done by ganesha when ganesha
is used as CephFS's gateway (manila's usecase)

This is the recommended Ganesha setting as libcephfs
already caches information. Doing so helps avoid
cache incoherency issues.

Change-Id: Iacd575ac61b39ab9dcf8814514b5e3267570a17f
Closes-Bug: #1898950

commit_message:
Allow kwargs in get_timestamp

As a part of the scenario/manager.py stabilization tracked by
the below BP the patch adds kwargs argument to support
username parameter of get_remote_client() method.

Change-Id: I8e0da8b19b2b0b147b36c392fa4e161115325cd7
Implements: blueprint tempest-scenario-manager-stable

commit_message:
Move python-tackerclient to new hacking 4.0.0

New rule enforcement has been enabled in the latest hacking code.

This patch bumps new version of hacking in test-requirements file,
for early detection and to avoid code breakage later when hacking
changes are released.

Change-Id: Ic54af7096b58259d6ee434a743ce9b75b7b61f28

commit_message:
Pin Bandit on py2

...and, since the previous tag didn't have the Bandit pin, make the
rolling upgrade job non-voting. We should plan on backporting this so we
can check that upgrades from stable branches are still OK.

See also: https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/654

Change-Id: If7f3ad8b275271d748426133232ed06c2a1cd1de

commit_message:
Omit resource inventories from placement update if zero

When a compute node has zero total available for the:

  * MEMORY_MB
  * DISK_GB
  * VGPU
  * PMEM_NAMESPACE_*

resource classes, we attempt to PUT an inventory with 'total' of 0
which isn't allowed by the placement API. Doing this results in a 400
error from placement "JSON does not validate: 0 is less than the
minimum of 1" and ResourceProviderUpdateFailed and
ResourceProviderSyncFailed raised in nova.

We are already omitting most resource classes when their total amount
of the resource is 0 and we just need to also do it for the
aforementioned resource classes.

Closes-Bug: #1901120
Closes-Bug: #1906494

Change-Id: I022f3bbddbbdc24362b10004f273da2421788c97
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/48/759348/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: result = { orc.MEMORY_MB: { }, } result[orc.DISK_GB] = { 'total': disk_gb, 'min_unit': 1, 'max_unit': disk_gb, 'step_size': 1, 'allocation_ratio': ratios[orc.DISK_GB], 'reserved': (self._get_reserved_host_disk_gb_from_config() + self._get_disk_size_reserved_for_image_cache()), }

the desired outcome.

commands.

commit_message:
Update to container image repo k8s.gcr.io

gcr.io/google_containers/ no longer contains the image versions we
require, use the new location.

Change-Id: Iabb9e672e494f27d1a3691a9ce0dd2ccf10d5797

commit_message:
Remove /etc/ceph dependency on puppet services

In tripleo-heat-templates a new 'CephConfigPath' parameter
is introduced with the purpose of customizing the path where the
Ceph config and keyring files are created on the host.
This change makes sure that puppet-tripleo is able to consume
a custom location for the Ceph config and keyring files.

Closes-Bug: #1708302
Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iaabb66cd26f0246defe391a4e34f4eab3c3c5fee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/45/763545/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] Remove default OSD configuration

The default, directory-based OSD configuration doesn't appear to work
correctly and isn't really being used by anyone. It has been commented
out and the comments have been enhanced to document the OSD config
better. With this change there is no default configuration anymore, so
the user must configure OSDs properly in their environment in
values.yaml in order to deploy OSDs using this chart.

Change-Id: I8caecf847ffc1fefe9cb1817d1d2b6d58b297f72

commit_message:
Enable cephFS snapshots in manila

To use the snapshots capability that the cephfs drivers have
we need to set the share type extra spec enable_snapshot support
to True

Change-Id: I45dddd49578eaca81276bbf44a44701c80b8a8c4

subject: [Stable Only] Handle libvirt reporting incorrect 4k page quantities
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-10-12 09:58:02.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0220d8ca34c46434952b1c1151ec80af7b40abb8', 'message': "[Stable Only] Handle libvirt reporting incorrect 4k page quantities

libvirt < 4.3.0 had an issue whereby assigning more than 4 GB of huge
pages would result in an incorrect value for the number of 4k (small)
pages [1]. This was fixed in 4.3.0 and the fixes appear to have been
backported to the libvirt versions for RHEL 7.4+.  However, this is
still an issue with the versions of libvirt available on Ubuntu 16.04,
18.04 and who knows what else. Work around the issue using the rest of
the (correct) values for different page sizes and warn the user so they
know what's going on.

This is stable only since the minimum version of libvirt was bumped in
Victoria, meaning this no longer applies there.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1569678

Change-Id: I28a7222d3ab80bb05e10caf753b4e78be2603c30
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811870
"}]
commit_message:
[Stable Only] Handle libvirt reporting incorrect 4k page quantities

libvirt < 4.3.0 had an issue whereby assigning more than 4 GB of huge
pages would result in an incorrect value for the number of 4k (small)
pages [1]. This was fixed in 4.3.0 and the fixes appear to have been
backported to the libvirt versions for RHEL 7.4+.  However, this is
still an issue with the versions of libvirt available on Ubuntu 16.04,
18.04 and who knows what else. Work around the issue using the rest of
the (correct) values for different page sizes and warn the user so they
know what's going on.

This is stable only since the minimum version of libvirt was bumped in
Victoria, meaning this no longer applies there.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1569678

Change-Id: I28a7222d3ab80bb05e10caf753b4e78be2603c30
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1811870
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/24/757524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @ddt.unpack @ddt.data((False, False), (False, True), (True, False)) @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LOG.warning') def test_get_host_numa_topology_broken_libvirt_meminfo(self, has_min_version, wrong_qty, mock_warning): """Ensure we correctly handle issues with libvirt < 4.3.0. libvirt < 4.3.0 reported incorrect values for small pages. We need to work around this. Ensure that happens. See bug #1811870 for more info. https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1811870 """ caps = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCaps() caps.host = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCapsHost() caps.host.cpu = vconfig.LibvirtConfigCPU() caps.host.cpu.arch = fields.Architecture.X86_64 caps.host.topology = fakelibvirt.NUMATopology() for i, cell in enumerate(caps.host.topology.cells): cell.memory = 16298528 # ~ 16 GiB # the incorrect values below were taken from a real-world system page_qty = 3075208 if wrong_qty else 2026632 cell.mempages = fakelibvirt.create_mempages( [(4, page_qty), (2048, 4000), (1048576, 0)]) drvr = libvirt_driver.LibvirtDriver(fake.FakeVirtAPI(), False) version = versionutils.convert_version_to_int( libvirt_driver.MIN_LIBVIRT_SMALL_PAGE_REPORTING) if not has_min_version: version -= 1 with test.nested( mock.patch.object( host.Host, 'get_capabilities', return_value=caps), mock.patch.object( hardware, 'get_vcpu_pin_set', return_value=set([0, 1, 3, 4, 5])), mock.patch.object( host.Host, 'get_online_cpus', return_value=set([0, 1, 2, 3, 6])), mock.patch.object( fakelibvirt.Connection, 'getLibVersion', return_value=version), ): got_topo = drvr._get_host_numa_topology() # in all cases the page counts must be accurate for cell in got_topo.cells: # the 4k pages total should always return 2026632 pages self.assertEqual(4, cell.mempages[0].size_kb) self.assertEqual(2026632, cell.mempages[0].total) self.assertEqual(2048, cell.mempages[1].size_kb) self.assertEqual(4000, cell.mempages[1].total) self.assertEqual(1048576, cell.mempages[2].size_kb) self.assertEqual(0, cell.mempages[2].total) # however the logs are only shown if the libvirt-provided value was # incorrect if not has_min_version and wrong_qty: self.assertTrue(mock_warning.called) else: self.assertFalse(mock_warning.called)

commit_message:
Update build-chart playbook

The build-chart playbook task to point each chart to helm-toolkit
has a find command that when used with another repo, will
include the charts for osh-infra as well.

This change modifies the playbook to only modify requirements
in charts in the repo being published.

Change-Id: I493b4c64fe2525bac0acae06bd40c3896c918e20

commit_message:
Fix TypeError when there exists image with size None

When there exists image with size None(e.g.,images whose status is
queued), test_list_images_param_sort will raise TypeError:
TypeError: '<' not supported between instances of 'int' and 'NoneType',
So we should ignore images with size None.

Change-Id: Ie084c65303238eaeff0a753915356d72aa039434
Closes-Bug: #1905515
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/29/764129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fallback to rdo registry if quay gets down

Currently we pull registry2 container from quay and sometimes
quay also gets down.

This patch adds a rescue method to fallback to rdo registry to
pull registry2 content.

Change-Id: I037f38ced5f73135aa0ea5c62b9a844166b2c185
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Build container images in ci centos gate job

Like other zuul jobs let's also build containers
in ci centos jobs instead of pulling from docker.io
where requests are rate limited.

Also use ubi8:8.2 for #1902846.

Related-Bug: #1902846
Depends-On: Iad71c1af41b2039591eccdb420c2a35b05ade4ac
Change-Id: If99fc787109495f8ce7ed5556243a7ed8f74537e

commit_message:
Retire the qinling-dashboard project

As announced in openstack-discuss ML[1], Qinling project
is retiring in Wallaby cycle.

This commit retires the qinling-dashboard repository as per
process deinfed in project-guide[2]. Anyone would like to
maintain it again, please revert back this commit and propose
the re-adding it to governance.

The community wishes to express our thanks and appreciation to all of
those who have contributed to the qinling-dashboard project over the years.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/764520
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/764523

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018638.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository

Change-Id: Ib1953185ed61f237040a9e4e5e727fd5e2befdb8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qinling-dashboard refs/changes/22/764522/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
lower-constraints: Bump packaging to 20.4

This version of packaging is actually required by oslo.utils as of 4.5
by Ic9bda0783d3664e1f518d513d81b3271028335fd that was itself introduced
as a lower-constraints version within Nova as of
Ic4d3b998bb9701cb1e3ef12d9bb6f4d91cc19c18.

Change-Id: I67255fa1b919a27e92028da95d71ddd4bf53edc1
Closes-Bug: #1907117

commit_message:
tripleo_deploy_artifacts has wrong tar syntax

The archive name should be immediately preceded by the f flag. Also,
removing stderr redirection to facilitate troubleshooting in case
something goes wrong like this.

This also includes a new unittest to validate that deploy_targz
actually works.

Change-Id: I71ebab9a2f595892e64c78688ecbb4502812fc0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/61/765861/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I7735b166a92921a11a82446638b60a2fbb304889
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qinling-dashboard refs/changes/61/684561/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/victoria

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ida1c8d075e4c7a148bc50c6365c4c1f479d5cea7

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I38f0e8751c86771343e52f15455bd005305f20cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qinling-dashboard refs/changes/35/644435/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8e7b872f8120e67604df6a63e9957b4a7224ab80
